channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What Polls Are Telling Us as Democrats Convene in Chicago
item.description: But beware another historic miss by pollsters.

item.title: Zelensky Says Ukraine Now Controls About 480 Square Miles of Russian Territory
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine seized on the incursion’s success to press allies to lift a longtime restriction: the use of Western-supplied long-range weapons against Russia.

item.title: After a slew of setbacks, Swedish EV champion Northvolt is winding down part of its U.S. operations as it reevaluates its business
item.description: Northvolt is a pioneer in its own right. But delays and limping EV demand, have hurt its business.

item.title: Kamala Harris Isn’t Bluffing
item.description: So far in the 2024 election, the party known for aversion to risk has been making better risk-management decisions.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Blinken Pushes for Gaza Cease-Fire, With Visits to Egypt and Qatar
item.description: After meetings in Israel, Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken will press Hamas leadership through intermediaries to continue talks on a deal.

item.title: These boom-and-bust tech cycles show that if AI investment wanes, the recovery will be quick
item.description: Overinvestment in AI has the potential to lead to another market downfall if the products that come to market aren’t as cutting-edge as anticipated.

item.title: How Biden Changed His Party
item.description: We explore three ways the president has shaped the Democratic Party.

item.title: Israel Says It Recovered Bodies of 6 Hostages in Gaza
item.description: The bodies were retrieved in an overnight operation in southern Gaza, the Israeli military said. Five of the hostages were already known to have died in captivity.

item.title: There are only 15 people whose wealth is greater than $100 billion (and they’d be richer if they weren’t giving it away)
item.description: LVMH’s Bernard Arnault remains in the $100 billion club despite a stock decline removing more than $10 billion from his net worth overnight.

item.title: ‘There Was a Whole Lot of Sass for a Gathering of Democrats’: The Best and Worst Moments From Night 1 of the Convention
item.description: What our columnists and contributors thought of speeches from Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, Hillary Clinton and Joe Biden on the event’s first night.

item.title: Typhoon Jongdari Nears South Korea, Bringing Threat of Flooding
item.description: The storm has caused flight cancellations in the country’s south. It is forecast to skirt the west coast before making landfall on Wednesday near Seoul.

item.title: TSMC breaks ground on €10 billion factory in Germany amid growing China-Taiwan tensions
item.description: Germany is fronting €5 billion in subsidies to help construct the Dresden fab with TSMC.

item.title: Israel Says It Recovered Bodies of 6 Hostages in Gaza
item.description: The bodies were retrieved in an overnight operation in southern Gaza, the Israeli military said. Five of the hostages were already known to have died in captivity.

item.title: The Bitter Fight Over the Meaning of ‘Genocide’
item.description: Debates over how to describe conflicts in Gaza, Myanmar and elsewhere are channeling a controversy as old as the word itself.

item.title: Climate change amplified storm that sank British tycoon’s superyacht—with expert predicting more catastrophes in Italy
item.description: British-flagged yacht the 'Bayesian', owned by Mike Lynch, capsized and sunk off the coast of Sicily on Monday.
